intro: Polygala nova, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, delicate flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Polygala nova is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
